attributes.comment:
Good morning,

I understand that the USCIS is considering increasing its fees, which would be a
sincere hardship on adoptive parents like me. In 2000 I began the paper work to
adopt my daughter and the fees were considerably less than they are now. Now I
am in process of waiting the match of my second daughter and have already paid
increased fees since the last adoption. While they may not be intended as such,
increases on increases seem like a penalty levied of people like me who want to
give a child in need a home, rather than add to the world?s population.

On top of it all, my I-171h is going to expire and I will need to shell out even more
money for an updated home study, fingerprints and USCIS fees. In addition, the
update requires another day out of work without pay for the USCIS appointment.
The emotionally exhausting wait, paper trail, financial strain and now salt in the
wounds increased fees only adds to what should be a hopeful and happy time in
parenthood.

Raising children in this day and age is expensive enough. The increased cost of
healthcare, fuel, education etc. is enough to worry about. As our government by
the people and for the people, I respectfully plead for decreased USCIS fees s that
will help EASE the financial burden of parenthood, not cripple it.

Hopefully,

Diane Dunleavy

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Diane C. Dunleavy
